    • Method Detail

      • heapify

        public static SingleItemSketch heapify(org.apache.datasketches.memory.Memory srcMem)
        Creates a SingleItemSketch on the heap given a SingleItemSketch Memory image and assumes the DEFAULT_UPDATE_SEED.
        Parameters:
        srcMem - the Memory to be heapified. It must be a least 16 bytes.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • heapify

        public static SingleItemSketch heapify(org.apache.datasketches.memory.Memory srcMem,
                                       long seed)
        Creates a SingleItemSketch on the heap given a SingleItemSketch Memory image and a seed. Checks the seed hash of the given Memory against a hash of the given seed.
        Parameters:
        srcMem - the Memory to be heapified
        seed - a given hash seed
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(long datum)
        Create this sketch with a long.
        Parameters:
        datum - The given long datum.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(double datum)
        Create this sketch with the given double (or float) datum. The double will be converted to a long using Double.doubleToLongBits(datum), which normalizes all NaN values to a single NaN representation. Plus and minus zero will be normalized to plus zero. The special floating-point values NaN and +/- Infinity are treated as distinct.
        Parameters:
        datum - The given double datum.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(String datum)
        Create this sketch with the given String. The string is converted to a byte array using UTF8 encoding. If the string is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.

        Note: this will not produce the same hash values as the create(char[]) method and will generally be a little slower depending on the complexity of the UTF8 encoding.

        Parameters:
        datum - The given String.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(byte[] data)
        Create this sketch with the given byte array. If the byte array is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        data - The given byte array.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(char[] data)
        Create this sketch with the given char array. If the char array is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.

        Note: this will not produce the same output hash values as the create(String) method but will be a little faster as it avoids the complexity of the UTF8 encoding.

        Parameters:
        data - The given char array.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

        Returns:

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(long datum,
                                      long seed)
        Create this sketch with a long and a seed.
        Parameters:
        datum - The given long datum.
        seed - used to hash the given value.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(double datum,
                                      long seed)
        Create this sketch with the given double (or float) datum and a seed. The double will be converted to a long using Double.doubleToLongBits(datum), which normalizes all NaN values to a single NaN representation. Plus and minus zero will be normalized to plus zero. The special floating-point values NaN and +/- Infinity are treated as distinct.
        Parameters:
        datum - The given double datum.
        seed - used to hash the given value.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(String datum,
                                      long seed)
        Create this sketch with the given String and a seed. The string is converted to a byte array using UTF8 encoding. If the string is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.

        Note: this will not produce the same output hash values as the create(char[]) method and will generally be a little slower depending on the complexity of the UTF8 encoding.

        Parameters:
        datum - The given String.
        seed - used to hash the given value.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(byte[] data,
                                      long seed)
        Create this sketch with the given byte array and a seed. If the byte array is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        data - The given byte array.
        seed - used to hash the given value.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

      • create

        public static SingleItemSketch create(char[] data,
                                      long seed)
        Create this sketch with the given char array and a seed. If the char array is null or empty no create attempt is made and the method returns null.

        Note: this will not produce the same output hash values as the create(String) method but will be a little faster as it avoids the complexity of the UTF8 encoding.

        Parameters:
        data - The given char array.
        seed - used to hash the given value.
        Returns:
        a SingleItemSketch or null

        Description copied from class: Sketch
        Returns the number of storage bytes required for this Sketch in its current state.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentBytes in class Sketch
        Parameters:
        compact - if true, returns the bytes required for compact form. If this sketch is already in compact form this parameter is ignored.
        Returns:
        the number of storage bytes required for this sketch

      • getLowerBound

        public double getLowerBound(int numStdDev)
        Description copied from class: Sketch
        Gets the approximate lower error bound given the specified number of Standard Deviations. This will return getEstimate() if isEmpty() is true.
        Overrides:
        getLowerBound in class Sketch
        Parameters:
        numStdDev - See Number of Standard Deviations
        Returns:
        the lower bound.

      • getRetainedEntries

        public int getRetainedEntries(boolean valid)
        Description copied from class: Sketch
        Returns the number of entries that have been retained by the sketch.
        Specified by:
        getRetainedEntries in class Sketch
        Parameters:
        valid - if true, returns the number of valid entries, which are less than theta and used for estimation. Otherwise, return the number of all entries, valid or not, that are currently in the internal sketch cache.
        Returns:
        the number of retained entries
